thread.section_title: Business & Financial News, U.S & International Breaking News | Reuters
thread.title: Canada's Trudeau says U.S. tariffs on steel would be 'unacceptable'

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Canada's Trudeau says U.S. tariffs on steel would be 'unacceptable'
text:
OTTAWA (Reuters) - Canada’s Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Friday any U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum imports would be“absolutely unacceptable” and said his government would continue to engage with U.S. officials on the issue.
FILE PHOTO - Canada's Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks during Question Period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, February 28, 2018. REUTERS/Chris Wattie Officials have not said whether U.S. President Donald Trump’s plan for tariffs of 25 percent on steel imports and 10 percent on aluminum products would include imports from Canada and Mexico.
Reporting by Leah Schnurr; Editing by James Dalgleish
